Sentencas: Low temperature operation of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFC) typically provides limited and insufficient power for practical applications.
Titulo: A low temperature SOFC as a self-promoted reactor for CO2 catalytic hydrogenation

Sentencas: The present work demonstrates how this limited power can be utilized effectively for the promotion of a catalytic reaction taking place on a catalyst electrode with minimal energy consumption and environmental impact.
Titulo: A low temperature SOFC as a self-promoted reactor for CO2 catalytic hydrogenation

Sentencas: A novel design of a low-temperature SOFC reactor is reported and utilized for the electrochemical promotion of CO2 hydrogenation, a reaction of both environmental and industrial importance.
Titulo: A low temperature SOFC as a self-promoted reactor for CO2 catalytic hydrogenation

Sentencas: The power demand for the enhancement of the catalytic reaction rates is produced in situ by the cell during the parallel oxidation of hydrogen which acts both as a reactant and as a fuel.
Titulo: A low temperature SOFC as a self-promoted reactor for CO2 catalytic hydrogenation

Sentencas: The results of the present study pave the way for the utilization of Electrochemical Promotion of Catalysis (EPOC) in a wireless configuration, using exclusively the internal power of low temperature, low pressure, SOFCs.
Titulo: A low temperature SOFC as a self-promoted reactor for CO2 catalytic hydrogenation
